alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Stewart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:39PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Chattahoochee and north central Stewart Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 439 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Jamestown/south Fort Benning, or near Cusseta, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Cusseta, Christopher, Jamestown/south Fort Benning, Renfroe, Louvale, Manta and Battle Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
